title: Flounce, 1700–50
medium:
Medium: linen
Technique: bobbin lace, Brussels style
creditline: Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf
description: Flounce fragment of Point d'Angleterre à Réseau with large medallions separated by interconnecting bands and surrounded by floral and foliated sprays, fantastic animals, and rocaille ornament. Medallions composed of alternating scenes; one showing seahorses driven by Neptune holding a triton beneath which are sea animals and additional rocaille decoration with birds perched in foliated branches. The other cartouche is topped by a large trophy above which a winged bird carries a floral spray.

tombstone.epitaph:
Flounce, 1700–50.
1700–50. Medium: linen
Technique: bobbin lace, Brussels style. Bequest of Richard Cranch Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline Emma Greenleaf. 1962-50-183.
